results.title: Interview with Ben Whitham
results.brief_description: In war, you are discouraged from keeping records or taking photographs. However, soldiers broke those rules in order to help remember. Born on a small soldier’s settlement farm, Ben Witham grew up hearing stories about the war. Having a father who served in Gallipoli, to his own service in World War II, Witham recalls the camaraderie and the lighter side of war. He emphasises the bonds of fellow servicemen and the celebration of this during commemorations for ANZACs.

results.title: Interview with a vampire: the vampire chronicles (S)
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, David Geffen and Geffen Pictures
results.brief_description: The first of Anne Rice’s “Vampire Chronicles” was brought to the screen by Neil Jordan. Despite initial public misgivings, Tom Cruise is convincingly seductive and evil as the Vampire Lestat. Brad Pitt plays Louis, the narrator of the strange history of his journey into immortality as a vampire. These two are ably supported by an all star cast including Christian Slater, Antonio Banderas, Kirsten Dunst and Stephen Rea. Jordan’s film is visually striking and sensual; so much so that the viewer is often torn between a world full of blood and horror and the allurement of immortality and the supernatural.

results.title: Interview game: Body language
results.brief_description: Gestures, facial expressions and posture are non-verbal ways of communicating feelings and attitude. How to read and react to body language is the subject of this video. It promotes the kind of people skills needed when conducting or going for a job interview. Factors contributing to successful inteviews which are covered include: preparation, location of the interview, placement of the furniture, note taking and speech patterns.

results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Veronika Soul, Caroline Leaf, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A freewheeling cinematic experience, this film is the work of two Canadian filmmakers, Caroline Leaf and Veronica Soul who relate their perceptions of each other through their respective animation techniques. Images and words are paired in startling associations. Each does a visual portrait of the other, based on characteristic gestures and impressions. A combination of techniques and materials, including live action, animation, photographs and drawings, produces a film of rich visual texture shaped by the hands and heads of two very different people. (Awards: Varna; Montreal; Grand Prix winner of Melbourne Film Festival 1980.)

results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”
A factory worker complains to his union delegate when he is required to work overtime at short notice. The film pinpoints the need for the delegate to calm down the union member and sort out the facts before he can discuss the incident with management.

results.title: Intersection collision
results.creator_credit: Amir M Karimi and University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center
results.brief_description: Provides information on intersection collision and on safety devices, and procedures that can reduce injuries. Discusses factors associated with door latch failure and motorist ejection, demonstrates the protection provided to motorists by the combined shoulder strap and lap belt, presents preliminary findings on tempered glass breakage, and illustrates car collision deformation and skid patterns.

results.title: Interscan MLS
results.brief_description: In the quest for an international standard Microwave Landing System for aircraft, Australia has developmed Interscan. The CSIRO Division of Radio Physics undertook this development using their knowledge and technology acquired by their pioneering research into radio astronomy. Filmed at Tullamarine Airport, Melbourne.

results.title: Interruptions
results.creator_credit: Thomas MacNeil, William Hoke, Pacific Northwest Bell Telephone Company and Hoke Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how seven individuals have accepted their disabilities and learned to transcend their limitations. It also shows how employers have dispensed of common prejudices and have employed handicapped individuals, and have found them to be effective workers.

results.title: Interrogation of enemy airmen
results.creator_credit: United States. Army Air Forces. First Motion Picture Unit
results.brief_description: An instructional film demonstrating the techniques available to army personnel involved in the interrogation of prisoners of war. Using classroom techniques and role playing scenarios, good and bad methods are demonstrated. Highlights the importance of examining a prisoner’s belongings to establish a personal profile before interrogation commences; shows how to use subordination techniques with captured officers to establish power and control; illustrates methods that may psychologically manipulate a prisoner to devulge intelligence information; shows how to identify the rank of a prisoner. Interrogation segments are in German, Italian and Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Interrogation and counsel
results.brief_description: This film raises for discussion some alternative police interrogation procedures and the rights of the accused to notification of their rights and, if necessary, to effective legal representation. The Fifth and Sixth Amendments to the American Bill of Rights are presented and related to two simulated cases.
